name: Pagination
description: The Pagination component supports both classical pagination and infinity scrolling.

props.name: mode
props.doc: If set to `infinity`, then the pagination bar will be now shown and but infinity scrolling will do the content presentation. For more information, check out the [Infinity Scroller](/uilib/components/pagination/infinity-scroller). Defaults to `pagination`.

props.name: paginationBarLayout
props.doc: The layout of the pagination bar. Defaults to `vertical`.

props.name: children
props.doc: The given content can be either a function or a React node, depending on your needs. A function contains several helper functions. More details down below and have a look at the examples in the demos section.

props.name: align
props.doc: Define the alignment of the pagination button bar. Can be `center`, `left` or `right`. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: startup_page
props.doc: The page shown in the very beginning. If `current_page` is set, then it may not make too much sense to set this as well.

props.name: current_page
props.doc: The page shown at the moment the component renders. Defaults to `1`.

props.name: page_count
props.doc: The total pages count. Defaults to `1`.

props.name: startup_count
props.doc: Defines how many `infinity` pages should be loaded / shown on the first render. Defaults to `1`.

props.name: parallel_load_count
props.doc: Defines how many `infinity` pages should be loaded / shown once the user scrolls down. Defaults to `1`.

props.name: min_wait_time
props.doc: The minimum time to wait, if the infinity scroll was invoked under that time threshold. This prevents not intentional infinity scroll loop calls. Defaults to `400` milliseconds.

props.name: place_maker_before_content
props.doc: If set to `true`, the infinity marker will be placed before the content (on top off). This could potentially have negative side effects. But it depends really on the content if this would make more sense to use instead. Defaults to `false`. This prop is deprecated and will be removed in v11, use `place_marker_before_content` instead.

props.name: place_marker_before_content
props.doc: If set to `true`, the infinity marker will be placed before the content (on top off). This could potentially have negative side effects. But it depends really on the content if this would make more sense to use instead. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: use_load_button
props.doc: If set to `true` it will disable the automated infinity scrolling, but shows a load more button at the of the content instead.

props.name: hide_progress_indicator
props.doc: If set to `true` no indicator will be shown.

props.name: page_element
props.doc: By default a `<div>` is used. Set it to any element you have to use. Adds also a class: `dnb-pagination__page` shown.

props.name: fallback_element
props.doc: (infinity mode) is used by the _indicator_, _load more_ bar as well as by the marker. Defaults to a `div`.

props.name: indicator_element
props.doc: (infinity mode) is used by the _indicator_. Falls back to `fallback_element` if not defined.

props.name: marker_element
props.doc: (infinity mode) is used by the internal marker. Falls back to `fallback_element` if not defined.

props.name: set_content_handler
props.doc: Callback function to get the `setContent` handler from the current pagination instance. e.g. `set_content_handler={fn => (...)}`. Use this handler to insert content during infinity mode.

props.name: reset_content_handler
props.doc: Callback function to get the `resetContent` handler from the current pagination instance. e.g. `reset_content_handler={fn => (...)}`. Use this handler to reset all the content. You can set it to `true`, to programmatically reset the content.

props.name: reset_pagination_handler
props.doc: Callback function to get the `resetInfinity` handler from the current pagination instance. e.g. `reset_pagination_handler={fn => (...)}`. Use this handler to reset all the internal states. You can set it to `true`, to programmatically reset the states.

props.name: end_infinity_handler
props.doc: Callback function to get the `endInfinity` handler from the current pagination instance. e.g. `end_infinity_handler={fn => (...)}`. Use this handler to end the infinity scrolling procedure, in case the `page_count` is unknown.

props.name: button_title
props.doc: The title used in every button shown in the bar. Defaults to `Side %s`.

props.name: next_title
props.doc: The title used in the next page button. Defaults to `Neste side`.

props.name: prev_title
props.doc: The title used in the previous page button. Defaults to `Forrige side`.

props.name: more_pages
props.doc: The title used in the dots. Relevant for screen readers. Defaults to `%s flere sider`.

props.name: is_loading_text
props.doc: Shown until new content is inserted in to the page. Defaults to `Laster nytt innhold`.

props.name: barSpace
props.doc: Used to set spacing for the pagination bar. Has to be an object with either: `top`, `right`, `bottom` or `left`. Use spacing values like: `small`, `1rem`, `1` or , `16px`. See property [space](/uilib/layout/space/properties).

props.name: load_button_text
props.doc: Used during infinity mode. If `use_load_button` is set to `true`, then a button is show on the bottom. If the `startup_page` is higher than 1. Defaults to `Vis mer innhold`.

props.name: loadButton
props.doc: Used to set load button text and icon alignment. Accepts a function returning a ReactNode too, so you can replace the button with your own component.

props.name: disabled
props.doc: If set to `true`, all pagination bar buttons are disabled.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called for every page change, regardless if the mode is `mode="infinity"` or not. Returns an object with number of useful properties and methods. See below for more details.

events.name: on_startup
events.doc: Only on **infinity** mode. Will be called once the component is ready for interaction. Returns an object with number of useful properties and methods. See below for more details. **NB:** Will be called again as soon as we reset the content by calling `resetContent()`.

events.name: on_load
events.doc: Only on **infinity** mode. Will be called on every page interaction, also on the very first interaction. Returns an object with number of useful properties and methods. See below for more details.

events.name: on_end
events.doc: Only on **infinity** mode. Will be called once `page_count` is reached or `endInfinity` was called.
